messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?
We're being robbed. I've got a guy down.
Can you please tell me your location?
West Point Trail, West Fork. Firefighter Ron Huddleston's house.
And it's a robbery in progress?
Yes, we have the guy down. I've called several times. Hurry up.
Do you have him restrained?
Yes, but we need help immediately.
Ma'am, I need to ask you some questions. Can you give me your name?
Jill Huddleston.
Is he a stranger to you?
Yes, he's Hispanic, maybe around 45 or 50 years old. He's beaten us with a metal pipe.
Do you have any children in the house?
No, ma'am.
How did he get into the house?
He came in through the front door.
Have you or your husband been injured?
Yes, my husband is bleeding badly and may have a broken arm. I've been hit in the head several times with the pipe.
Is the assailant conscious?
Yes, we're holding him down.
What does your house look like so responders can identify it?
It's a brick house with shrubbery in front. My husband works for the Eagle Mountain Fire Department in Fort Worth.
We have deputies and EMS en route. Is your husband still holding him down?
Yes, but the guy is saying he has AIDS and we've got blood everywhere.
Don't try to use any more weapons. Do you still have the knife on you?
Yes, my husband's got the pipe now. You better get here. This guy won't be alive much longer.
Hang on, we have people coming. Did he say why he broke in?
He said he wanted money. We don't have much. Only $50 and some jewelry.
You mentioned a second suspect. Is someone else involved?
He kept telling us there was another person, but we haven't seen anyone else.
Where are you in the house?
We're in the main living room. The front door is unlocked.
Do you have any cars in your driveway?
Yes, our truck and a car.
Did the intruder come in through the front?
Yes, and he had a gun, but it's not loaded.
Alright. Deputies should be arriving shortly. Do you see them outside?
No, I can't see out the window.
Can you go to the front door while keeping him restrained?
I'm standing near him. My husband is holding him down.
Do you give permission for the deputies to enter the home?
Yes, they can come in. The front door is unlocked.
Do you see the deputies yet?
I can't see anything. I'm near the door.
They're checking in on scene. They should be there any moment.
I'm opening the gate for them.
Do you see the deputies now?
Yes, they're here. Where's EMS? My husband's head is bleeding badly.
As soon as the deputies secure the scene, they'll bring in EMS.
Okay, they're arriving now.
